Sets¶

Locate, analyze, expose and catalogue dataset entries.

The FilePropertiesTable class contains the minimal information about the file as well as basic statistical measurements.

Subclasses of this table can be created adding extra columns.

The experiment.CompressionExperiment class takes an instance of FilePropertiesTable to know what files the experiment should be run on.

enb.sets.get_all_test_files(ext='raw')¶

Get a list of all set files contained in the data dir.

Parameters

ext – if not None, only files with that extension (without dot) are returned by this method.

class enb.sets.FilePropertiesTable(csv_support_path=None, base_dir=None)¶

Table describing basic file properties (see decorated methods below). Unsigned 8-bit samples are assumed.

get_relative_path(file_path)¶

Get the relative path. Overwritten to handle the versioned path.

set_1B_value_counts(file_path, series)¶

Calculate a dict with the counts for each found byte value in file_path

set_file_entropy(file_path, series)¶

Return the zero-order entropy of the data in file_path (1-byte samples are assumed)

set_file_size(file_path, series)¶

Store the original file size in series :param file_path: path to the file to analyze :param series: dictionary of previously computed values for this file_path (to speed up derived values)

set_hash_digest(file_path, series)¶

Store the hexdigest of file_path’s contents, using hash_algorithm as configured. :param file_path: path to the file to analyze :param series: dictionary of previously computed values for this file_path (to speed up derived values)

set_histogram_fullness_1byte(file_path, series)¶

Set the fraction of the histogram (of all possible values that can be represented) is actually present in file_path, considering 1-byte samples.

set_histogram_fullness_2bytes(file_path, series)¶

Set the fraction of the histogram (of all possible values that can be represented) is actually present in file_path, considering 2-byte samples.

set_histogram_fullness_4bytes(file_path, series)¶

Set the fraction of the histogram (of all possible values that can be represented) is actually present in file_path, considering 4-byte samples.

set_samples(file_path, series)¶

Set the number of samples assuming 8-bit samples

class enb.sets.FileVersionTable(original_base_dir, version_base_dir, original_properties_table, version_name, csv_support_path=None)¶
get_df(target_indices, fill=True, overwrite=False, parallel_versioning=True, parallel_row_processing=True, target_columns=None)¶

Create a version of target_indices (which must all be contained in self.original_base_dir) into self.version_base_dir. Then return a pandas DataFrame containing all given indices and defined columns. If fill is True, missing values will be computed. If fill and overwrite are True, all values will be computed, regardless of whether they are previously present in the table.

Parameters

  • overwrite – if True, version files are written even if they exist

  • target_indices – list of indices that are to be contained in the table

  • parallel_versioning – if True, files are versioned in parallel if needed

  • parallel_row_processing – if True, file properties are gathered in parallel

  • target_columns – if not None, the list of columns that are considered for computation

version(input_path, output_path, file_info)¶

Create a version of input_path and save it into output_path.

Parameters

  • input_path – path to the file to be versioned

  • output_path – path where the version should be saved

  • file_info – metainformation available using super().get_df for input_path
